derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'catechu'): from French, from Portuguese cachu, from Malay kacu. The current sense dates from the early 18th cent

means.word_mean: 1. a scented lozenge used to sweeten the breath (e.g. to conceal the odor of tobacco)
